block.p: Donna Ellen McGraw, the daughter of Eleanor and Edward McGraw of New City, N.Y., was married last evening to Jason Gregory Weiss, the son of Katherine Weiss and Dr. Irwin Weiss of Pacific Palisades, Calif. The Rev. George Herzog, an interfaith minister, officiated at Tappan Hill in Tarrytown, N.Y.
The bride, a graduate of Brown University, and the bridegroom, who graduated with highest distinction from the University of Michigan, received law degrees from Harvard, his cum laude.

Donna Ellen McGraw, the daughter of Eleanor and Edward McGraw of New City, N.Y., was married last evening to Jason Gregory Weiss, the son of Katherine Weiss and Dr. Irwin Weiss of Pacific Palisades, Calif. The Rev. George Herzog, an interfaith minister, officiated at Tappan Hill in Tarrytown, N.Y.
The bride, a graduate of Brown University, and the bridegroom, who graduated with highest distinction from the University of Michigan, received law degrees from Harvard, his cum laude.

Mrs. Weiss, 33, is an associate at Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom, the Manhattan law firm. Her father is a pressman at The New York Times's production plant in College Point, Queens. Her mother retired as a sales agent for Century 21 A. B. Realty, which was in Tappan, N.Y.

Mr. Weiss, 30, is a founder and managing partner of Terrapin Partners, a merchant bank and consulting firm in Manhattan. His parents, who are retired, worked in Los Angeles. His mother was a partner in Fagan Weiss Public Relations, and his father was an ophthalmologist.
